elements.title: Lài dogs (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Lài dogs (pictured) were instrumental in the Vietnamese Lam Sơn uprising against Ming China in 1418–1428?

elements.title: Emory Collins (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that American racing driver Emory Collins won the International Motor Contest Association sprint car national championship in 1938, 1946, 1947, and 1948?

elements.title: Extensa (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Polish science fiction novel Extensa marked the growing recognition of its writer, Jacek Dukaj, in Poland?

elements.title: Constance Fozzard (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Constance Fozzard was told during her surgical training that women with children could not become consultants?

elements.title: LARIAT (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the LARIAT platform simulates users on computer networks to be targeted for staged cyber attacks?

elements.title: Melissa Clark-Reynolds (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Melissa Clark-Reynolds, who was awarded the Insignia of an Officer of the New Zealand Order of Merit, developed the now-defunct virtual world MiniMonos?

elements.title: 56 Beaver Street (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that guests to the Delmonico's restaurant at 56 Beaver Street touched a pair of columns at the entrance for good luck?

elements.title: Matti Lehtinen (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Matti Lehtinen, a baritone of the Finnish National Opera and professor of singing at the Sibelius Academy, was the voice of God at age 93?
